title: Potential Energy & Stability Quiz
description: Test your understanding of potential energy, conservative and non-conservative forces, work-energy theorem, equilibrium, and small oscillations.

questions.question: Which of the following forces is conservative?

options.explanation: Gravity is path-independent and has a well-defined potential energy (U = mgh).

questions.question: Work done by conservative forces over a closed path is:

options.explanation: In conservative fields, work done in a closed loop vanishes.

questions.question: A ball of mass 2 kg is lifted vertically by 5 m. Change in potential energy is:
Which equation represents the Work-Energy Theorem?

options.explanation: The work done by all forces equals the change in kinetic energy.

questions.question: A system is in stable equilibrium if:

options.explanation: Positive curvature of U indicates a restoring force.

questions.question: Which type of equilibrium does a ball at the top of a hill represent?

options.explanation: Any small displacement lowers U, making the system diverge away.

questions.question: Select all correct statements about equilibrium:

options.text: Unstable equilibrium requires U to be minimum

questions.question: A particle displaced slightly from stable equilibrium executes:

options.explanation: Near equilibrium, U(x) ≈ U₀ + ½kx², leading to SHM.
